citation.article-title: Gallaecimonas pentaromativorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium carrying 16S rRNA gene heterogeneity and able to degrade high-molecular-mass polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gallaecimonas pentaromativorans sp. nov.

Gallaecimonas pentaromativorans (pen′ta.ro.ma′ti.vo.rans. Gr. numeral penta five; L. n. aroma -atis spice; L. v. voro devour; N.L. part. adj. pentaromativorans degrading/devouring aromatic compounds with five rings).
The following properties are also observed in addition to those given in the genus description.
Colonies are circular, convex and grey-coloured on MA.
Growth is observed at 20–37 °C (optimum, 30 °C) and at pH 5–10 (optimum, pH 5–8).
Does not require NaCl for growth and can tolerate up to 7 % NaCl (optimum, 1–2 % NaCl).
Hydrolyses aesculin and gelatin and assimilates d-glucose, l-arabinose, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, malate and citrate.

Oxidizes α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, cellobiose, α-d-glucose, maltose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-galacturonic acid, α-, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acids, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, malonic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, l-alaninamide, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-leucine, l-proline, l-serine, l-threonine, urocanic acid, thymidine and α-d-glucose 1-phosphate.
The type strain, CEE_131T (=DSM 21945T=CECT 7479T), was isolated from intertidal sediment of Corcubion Ria in Cee, A Coruña, Spain.
